duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure the national Maternal Mental Health Hotline is available 24/7 to respond to callers and texters
Act as additional support to Hotline Counselors, providing emotional support and resources to pregnant and postpartum persons and their support/loved ones
Answer incoming calls, texts, and chats, and provide telephonic services, screenings, and treatment and recovery support in a culturally competent manner
Maintain complete, accurate, and timely documentation of cases in the Salesforce application
Provide immediate access to Hotline Counselors and report feedback to Clinical Supervisor and/or Hotline Services Manager
Ensure professional communication and collaboration with the remote team via various communication platforms

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, and documented perinatal (maternal) mental health training. Must be a licensed mental health clinician or a certified doula, lactation consultant, childbirth educator, or Peer Specialist
